intro: Pimpinella rigidiuscula, commonly known as the rigid dwarf parsley, is a small annual herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
